Abstract: This Mission study evaluates the participant training program in Indonesia. The study was based on oral interviews with 698 Indonesian participants representing 83% of those who had returned to Indonesia for at least 6 months and had assumed duties in their former or in new positions. Many recommendations on the training process are included. (Author abstract, modified)
Title: Evaluation of the participant training program in Indonesia

Abstract: This study examines the extent to which Taiwanese participants have utilized their training since their return home. The study was based on interviews with 715 of 787 participants who returned from U.S. and third country training between 1951 and March, 1957 and with 615 supervisors. Recommendations focus on training design, trainee selection, pre-departure preparation, orientation, follow-up, and utilization of training. (Author abstract, modified)
Title: Evaluation of the participant program in Taiwan : 1951-1957

Personal_Author: Anderson, Daniel V.|Wiens, Henry|Johnson, Henry P.
Title: Evaluation of Guatemala program
